alert.note: Alert for Dimmit; Maverick (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 7:05PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Dimmit, Maverick and Zavala. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 705 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eagle Pass, Crystal City, Carrizo Springs, Big Wells, La Pryor, El Indio, Batesville, Quemado, Asherton, Chula Vista, Winter Haven, Cometa, Chula Vista-River Spur, Las Colonias, Carrizo Hill, Brundage, Loma Vista, Gilson Groves, Catarina and Las Vegas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
